pageContext.claim: “Gasoline for cars is gone. They have a lot of electric cars. That's all gone because they have no elec- -- they have nothing. What a job. When we talk about socialism, take a look at Venezuela.”
pageContext.analysis: Venezuela is in a gasoline crisis and the country has been plagued with blackouts, but they don't have "a lot of electric cars." No country in South America is among the top-selling for light-duty, plug-in electric vehicle, according to Hybrid Cars. Nor is any South American country a member of the Electric Vehicles Initiative run by the International Energy Agency. EVI’s members account for 95 percent of all electric car registrations.
